page.title: 05Education within Wareham
page.content: The{County of Dorset}organises a three tier education system. Children begin school at four and a half and stay in a First School until they are nine. { {Lady St. Mary is our School.} We share a site with the Wareham Middle School. This school accepts children from the age of 9+ until l3. Because of the nature of the area several first schools feed Wareham M.S. All children from Middle Schools locally go on to the Purbeck Upper School. This school has in the region of 1,600 children as opposed to Lady St. Mary which has{200.} Once the children leave their First School,most of them have to{catch a bus}each day. The Purbeck Upper School has to serve an area of approx. 400 sq. kilometres. This makes the laying on of transport and the cost important factors in the local authorities education planning.
